name: Cascadia
premise: A peaceful and engaging game featuring the habitats and wildlife of the Pacific Northwest.
description: Cascadia is a nature-themed game where players use a unique card drafting and tile placement system to build out their own landscape, featuring stunning artwork of the Pacific Northwest.
session_playtime_notes: Playtime can vary depending on the number of players and their familiarity with the game.
immersiveness_level_notes: The game's artwork and mechanics work together to immerse players in the theme of Pacific Northwest wildlife.
learning_curve_notes: The rules are straightforward and easy to learn, making it accessible for both new and experienced players.
save_mechanism_notes: The game is intended to be played in one session.
how_to_win: The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
how_to_lose: Players who do not maximize their points through efficient card drafting and tile placement are likely to score fewer points.

reasons: The game requires strategic card drafting and tile placement.
There is an element of long-term planning in creating habitats and matching wildlife.
The game's theme and artwork are focused on the wildlife and habitats of the Pacific Northwest.

unique_selling_point: Unique card drafting and tile placement system
